did.unittitle: University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg, Athletic Department
did.abstract: Administrative Records of the Athletic Department of the University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg, 1969-present.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: All rights reserved. University of Pittsburgh.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Transferred from the UPG Athletic Department to the UPG Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg, Athletic Department, 1969-present, UPG.RG.21, UPG Archives, University of Pittsburgh Library System.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Frank Zabrosky in 2018.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Director of Athletics and Recreation, Athletic Committee, Bobcat Team (The Official Booster Club of UPG Athletics), Equity in Athletics Disclosure Act (EADA), Publications, Sports Awards Ceremony & Reception [Sports Banquet];[Athletic Award Ceremony];[Scholar-Athlete Awards Ceremony], Sports Schedule, Sports, UPG Bobcat Golf Outing [Bobcat Golf Outing]; Pitt-Greensburg Golf Outing

controlaccess.subject: Universities and colleges –- Pennsylvania –- Greensburg –- Records and correspondence
Universities and colleges -– Pennsylvania -– Greensburg -– Administration

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Contains: memo dtd 8/2/94 from Rick Fogle to the Enrollment Management Committee, Subject: UPG Athletics, Basketball and Baseball; Minutes 8/16/94, Enrollment Management Committee, "Planned Improvements for the '94-'95 Intramural Program"; Employment Management Initiatives [undtd]"; "Resolution to Implement a Student Athletic Fee at the University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg" passed by the University of Pittsburgh Board of Trustees at its annual meeting of June 22, 1995
Fall Term [2141 Term] Athletes vs. General Population GPA's [Sept. 2014]
9/8/05 [Announcement] Assistant Women's Basketball Coach, Sports Information Director, Other Coaching Assignment, Full-Time Position, Description of Application Procedures and Job Duties.
[2014] Fall Term [2141 Term] Athletes vs. General Population GPA's [Sept. 2014]
2018 [News Clippings GTR 8/20/2018] "Pitt-Greensburg Hires Yetter [Jeromy] as AD".
2018 [News Clipping: The Insider] "Jeromy Yetter Returns as New Athletics Director".
2018 [News Release 8/20/2018] "Jeromy Yetter named Athletic Director at Pitt-Greensburg".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Contains: Agenda for meeting, Oct. 5, 1994 and includes mission statement of the committee; Athletic Program, Target Fall 1995; UPG Athletics Fundraising Possibilities; memo from Dr. Mark McColloch dtd 10/4/94 (DMD could not attend the 10/5/94 meeting but wished to raise issues of concerns to him); agenda for 3/1/95 meeting; "Pitt-Greensburg 5 Year Plan, Intercollegiate Athletics" with a 5 year outline; "Budget Narrative'; "Collegiate Fall 1995 Athletic Program, Athletic Update 6/7/95".

did.unittitle: Bobcat Team (The Official Booster Club of UPG Athletics)
Bobcat Team (The Official Booster Club of UPG Athletics)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Equity in Athletics Disclosure Act of 1994, Section 360B of Public Law 103-382 requires that any institution of higher education that participates in any federal student financial aid program and has intercollegiate athletic programs must provide information concerning their intercollegiate athletic programs under the act.

did.unittitle: Pitt-Greensburg Athletics Web Site: Headlines For Articles Posted On The Pitt-Greensburg Web Site

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: [Archives holds only headlines and some abstracts of articles which appeared on the web site. Entries arranged in reverse chronological order.]

did.unittitle: Pitt-Greensburg Athletics Web Site: Headlines For Articles Posted On The Pitt-Greensburg Web Site
Sports Articles In The UPG Insider

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Annotated brief listing of [UPG] Insider articles, principally, on UPG sports programs but with some limited coverage of Pitt (Oakland Campus) athletic programs, i.e., football and basketball. List is in reverse chronological order. The [UPG] Insider must be consulted for full texts of the articles. Period of coverage: 2/28/06-4/12/09.

did.unittitle: Sports Articles In The UPG Insider

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Spring 2000 (April 9, 2000) Fall 2000 (November 10, 2000) Spring 2001 (April 8, 2001) Fall 2001 (November 18, 2001) Spring 2002 (April 14, 2002) Fall 2002 (December 6, 2002) Spring 2003 (April 13, 2003) Fall 2003 (December 7, 2003) Spring 2004 (May 8, 2004) Fall 2004 (Dec. 10, 2004) Spring 2005 (April 3, 2005) Spring 2005 (May 22, 2005) 2006, April 2. Winter Sports Awards. 2006, May 12. Spring Sports Awards. 2007, April 16. Department of Athletics First Annual All-Sports Award Banquet. [Program gives: 2006-2007 AMCC All-American Academic Team; AMCC All-Conference Performers; Department of Athletics Sport Team Achievements, 1997-2005; Department of Athletics Chronological History 1995-2004; Department of Athletics Facilities 1989-2005.] 2008, April 15. Pitt-Greensburg Dept. of Athletics 2nd Annual All-Sports Award Banquet. [Program gives: AMCC All-American Academic Team, 2007-2008; AMCC All-Conference Performers; 2007-2008 Allegheny Mountain Collegiate Conference All-Conference Sportsmanship Team; UPG Dept. of Athletics Sport Team Achievements, 1997-2008.] May 30, 2009. 2009 Athletics Award Ceremony. [Program gives: Inspirational Athlete of the Year Award [Award winner not identified in program]; All-Conference Recognition [Names of athletes recognized are given]; Chi Alpha Sigma Inductees [names of inductees not given]; Male and Female Scholar Athlete Award Winners [names of winners not included in this program]; Individual Statistic Recognition [Nicole Reiser, 1000 points; Kelsey Wilcox, 1000 points; Dan Waajid, 1000 points]; Male and Female Athletes of the Year [Names not included in the program]. 2013, Feb. 21 [From Intercom 2/25-3/3/13: 78 athletes [honored] for their outstanding academic achievement]. 2014, Feb. 27. [Extract from Blue & Gold #105 Spring 2014, "Scholar-Athletes Recognized". 75 student-athletes recognized for outstanding academic achievement, Fall 2013 semester.] 2015, Feb. 19. [Extract from Blue & Gold #108 Winter/Spring 2015. "Scholar-Athletes [88] Recognized for Achievements" 2016, [Spring] [Extract from Blue & Gold #111, Spring 2016, Fall [2015] Athletic Season Successful. [Awards, honors]].

Men's Basketball Alumni Club (MBAC) [Pitt-Greensburg Men's Basketball Alumni Club (MBAC) See: UPG.RG.39.2 Pitt-Greensburg Alumni Association Ser.: Subject Files. Men's Basketball Alumni Club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Basketball Strategy Plan Sheets. [undtd]

First varsity athletic team (Men's Basketball) fielded in 1969/70. First team basketball roster: Harry Bowser, [Fred Charles],Dave Chesser, Bernie Cobetto, Dan Cottrell, Steve Frick, Rich Hardway, John Jamison, Tom Jollie, Tom Kristan, Mike Noppe, [Alan Person], [Paul Sailley], Al Skrabski. Coach, John Hunter. Asst. Coach, August "Gus" Corso First game played away at Pitt-Titusville, Nov. 15, 1969. Pitt-Greensburg 87, Pitt-Titusville 54. First home game with Penn State-New Kensington, Dec. 4, 1969. Pitt-Greensburg 92, Penn State-New Kensington 89. Home games played at Greensburg Salem High School gymnasium. Record first season: 4 wins, 8 losses.

UPG Archives holds the following scrapbooks: Scrapbook, 1969/70. [Note: Housed in Utility [Cabinet 1]] Contains: news clippings, pictures, teams schedules, letters, statistics for the season. It also has a news story with newsprint picture of the first Cheerleader Team (1969/70) which included: Linda Adams, Karen Battistoni, Joan Boby, Donna DiMaria, Diane Kosic.)
1969/1970 [File folder containing photocopied newspaper articles of the 1969/1970 UPG Basketball season. [Given to the Archives by Alan Hudock in 2016]].

1970/71-1971/72 [File Folder containing photocopies of newspaper articles brought together and presented to the University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg Men's Basketball Alumni Club by Mr. Alan Hudock. Includes: Final Statistics 1970/71; TD which identifies the Team Roster for 1970/71 and gives the names of the Coaches, Managers, Trainers, Score Keepers, Time Keeper, Statisticians, Team Physician, Cheerleaders, Advisors, Student Government Assoc. members. [Given to the Archives by Alan Hudock in 2016.]]

Scrapbook, 1970/71-1971/1972 1 item [Note: Housed in Utility [Cabinet 1]] Contents: Primarily newspaper clippings with several other items of particular interest: 2 13" x 20" posters, "University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg Basketball Schedules, 1970-71, 1971-72 (annotated with wins and losses; 1 form, "Final Statistics 1970-1971" which gives: name of player; games played; field goal attempts, field goal attempts made, turnovers committed, fouls attempted, fouls made with %, total points, game average, rebounds made, game average, fouls committed; 2 team group photos. [Given to the Archives by Alan Hudock in 2017.]

Scrapbook, 1972/73. [Note: Housed in Utility [Cabinet 1]] Contains: news clippings, pictures, team schedule, 1972/73 team members included: Vince Dalicandro, Jeff Dodds, Robert Domenick, Michael Dunn, Jerry Fedele, Paul Floder, Michael Kasunic, Richard Kruzynzki, Mark Kudlik, Richard McFeeley, John Messner, Jim Murphy, Tony Quatrini, David Shaler, Jeff Systir. Coach, John Hunter. (Richard Kruzynski received the first annual Golden Panther Scholar-Athlete Award.)

Booklets 1970-1973 A. University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg Dept. of Athletics. 1970/71-1971/72 Contains inter alia: Coach Profiles, Individual Team Member Profiles, All time Pitt-Greensburg Record (Leading Scorers, Individual Marks), Team Record (Most Points, Field Goals, Season Record, Basketball Roster, Season's Final Statistics). B. Programs. 1970-1972/73. 1970, Nov. 10, Penn State, Beaver; 1971, Jan. 4, New Castle Business College; Jan. 28, Community College of Allegheny Co., Boyce Campus; Feb. 15, St. Vincent J.V.'s; Dec. 2, New Castle Business College; [1971, Dec. 11 (?)] St. Vincent J.V.'s; 1972, Jan. 20, Allegheny County Community College, South Campus; Feb. 21, Penn State, New Kensington; 1973, Jan. 29, St. Vincent J.V.'s.
Memorabilia

Mementos from the time that Carlyle Carter was a member of the 1971/72 basketball team and earned his team's MVP Player Award for his performance in the 3rd Annual University of Pittsburgh Regional Campus Basketball Tournament [Pitt-Greensburg, Pitt-Johnstown, Pitt-Bradford, Pitt-Titusville], Mar. 3-4, 1972, Pitt Field House and in which Pitt-Greensburg earned the Regional Campus Crown [Pitt-Greensburg 93, Pitt-Johnstown 87]. Items include: Uniform (Jersey #51; Shorts); the 1972 3rd Annual Regional Campus Tournament MVP Player Trophy; Game Basketball Hoop Net.
[Given to the UPG Archives by Carlyle Carter via Harry Bowser 12/2/2019]
[n.b. Stored in Archives Utility Cabinet faz 02/06/2020]
News Article "UPG Hoops Takes Big Step Forward", Greensburg Tribune-Review, 1/11/2020, p. B1, B3
